title-group.article-title: One-Step Piecewise Polynomial Galerkin Methods for Initial Value Problems

abstract.p: A new approach to the numerical solution of systems of first-order ordinary differential equations is given by finding local Galerkin approximations on each subinterval of a given mesh of size h. One step at a time, a piecewise polynomial, of degree n and class C<sup>0</sup>, is constructed, which yields an approximation of order O(h<sup>2n</sup>) at the mesh points and O(h<sup>n+1</sup>) between mesh points. In addition, the jth derivatives of the approximation on each subinterval have errors of order O(h<sup>n-j+1</sup>), 1 ≤ j ≤ n. The methods are related to collocation schemes and to implicit Runge-Kutta schemes based on Gauss-Legendre quadrature, from which it follows that the Galerkin methods are A-stable.
